page.title: 09Religion
page.content: As you drive up to the university you see a tall pointed tower. This is the Chaplaincy Centre. The Chaplaincy Centre has many different communities like Methodist, Roman Catholic, Anglican etc in the same building. The communities are in different rooms and above the rooms are flats for the clergy to live. The Chaplaincy Centre is shaped like a clover with 3 tall spires with a cross on the top of one of them. Inside the Chaplaincy Centre are meeting places to talk and plan things and on Sunday nights other people from other religions entertain each other. As well as church services the entertainment consists of guitar playing, singing or an interesting talk. The Chaplaincy Centre is the biggest centre of religion in Lancaster and people from outside the university come to worship there.
